On Sat, 24 Jan 2004 22:27:16 -0000, bobmcc20 <bobmcc20@...> wrote:

> Hello,
>
> I am using JUnit (or tying to at least) as part of one of my college
> classes. I read the installation document, and set the classpath as
> was stated. When I try to import junit.framework.* I get the error:
>
> package junit.framework does not exist
>
> Is there any other steps to installing JUnit that I missed? I am using
> Windows Xp if that helps.

First, welcome to the world of testing.  Second, you need to give us more 
information.  Are you using the commandline or an IDE?  What exactly is 
your CLASSPATH variable?

-- 
Jason Rogers
